abstract: During his presidential campaign, Vladimir V. Putin promised a large increase in government spending, but doing that without busting the Kremlin’s budget would require oil to reach unprecedented prices.
snippet: During his presidential campaign, Vladimir V. Putin promised a large increase in government spending, but doing that without busting the Kremlin’s budget would require oil to reach unprecedented prices.
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — In American presidential politics, high oil prices are a problem. For Vladimir V. Putin’s new presidential term in Russia, they will be a necessity — crucial to fulfilling his campaign promises to lift government spending by billions of dollars a year.

headline.main: Putin Needs Higher Oil Prices to Pay for Campaign Promises
headline.print_headline: Putin Needs Higher Oil Prices to Pay for Campaign Promises
